title: 488. Does Death Have to Be a Death Sentence?
description: In this special episode of People I (Mostly) Admire, Steve Levitt speaks with the palliative physician B.J. Miller about modern medicine’s goal of “protecting a pulse at all costs.” Is there a better, even beautiful way to think about death and dying?
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
